comments.body: do we plan to add flags to let you associate secrets?
In Origin we have `oc secrets add` for this. I'm not sure it would be best as a flag for creation.

> do we plan to add flags to let you associate secrets?

Not yet.  I think that's more likely to be a `kubectl set` sort of thing, though that command seems oddly pod-focused.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +31,35 @@Create a service account with the specified name.`

	serviceAccountExample = `  # Create a new service account named my-service-account
  $ kubectl create serviceaccount my-service-account`
)

comments.body: @kargakis didn't you make a method in the factory to centralize these choices and make sure that generic generators aren't used generically?

I had the original Generator method refactored but that was about returning Generators and not StructuredGenerators. With StructuredGenerators we have moved the responsibility in the command; see this switch. Until we have the need to plug our own structured generators in, we can live with this.
